alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Mainland Monroe County through 300 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Mahogany Hammock, or 13 miles north of Flamingo, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Everglades National Park. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
